title: Distributive Property
text: Observing this question, we find that we will need to apply the distributive property twice, once for each of the parentheses.

title: Distributive Property
text: The distributive property states that if a, $$b$$, c are real numbers, then $$a \left(b+c\right)=ab+ac$$, and $$a \left(b-c\right)=ab-ac$$.
speech: The distributive property states that if a,  b , c are real numbers, then , a, parentheses b plus c,  is equal to a b plus a c , and , a, parentheses b minus c,  is equal to, a b minus a c .
pacedSpeech: The distributive property states that if a,   b
, c are real numbers, then  , a,  b plus c,  is equal to a b plus a c
, and  , a,  b minus c,  is equal to, a b minus a c

title: Applying the Distributive Property
text: Applying the distributive property to $$5\left(2n+9\right)$$, we get the expression $$5\times2 n+5\times9$$.
speech: Applying the distributive property to  5 times, parentheses, 2 n plus 9,  , we get the expression  5 times 2 n plus 5 times 9 .
pacedSpeech: Applying the distributive property to   5 times, , 2 n plus 9,
, we get the expression   5 times 2 n plus 5 times 9

title: First Expression
text: Putting together the previous two parts, we get $$5\left(2n+9\right)=10n+45$$.
speech: Putting together the previous two parts, we get  5 times, parentheses, 2 n plus 9,  is equal to, 10 n plus 45 .
pacedSpeech: Putting together the previous two parts, we get   5 times, , 2 n plus 9,  is equal to, 10 n plus 45

title: Applying the Distributive Property
text: Applying the distributive property to $$12\left(n-3\right)$$, we get the expression $$12n-12\times3$$.
speech: Applying the distributive property to  12 times, parentheses n minus 3,  , we get the expression  12 n minus 12 times 3 .
pacedSpeech: Applying the distributive property to   12 times,  n minus 3,
, we get the expression   12 n minus 12 times 3

title: Second Expression
text: Putting together the previous parts, we get $$12\left(n-3\right)=12n-36$$.
speech: Putting together the previous parts, we get  12 times, parentheses n minus 3,  is equal to, 12 n minus 36 .
pacedSpeech: Putting together the previous parts, we get   12 times,  n minus 3,  is equal to, 12 n minus 36

title: Combine Like Terms
text: After applying the distributive property, the expression becomes $$10n+45+12n-36$$. Combine like terms, what do you get?
speech: After applying the distributive property, the expression becomes  10 n plus 45 plus 12 n minus 36 . Combine like terms, what do you get?
pacedSpeech: After applying the distributive property, the expression becomes   10 n plus 45 plus 12 n minus 36
. Combine like terms, what do you get?
